meanings.sent1: The rustproof car stayed shiny even after being exposed to rain.
meanings.sent2: The new bike was rustproof, so it didn't develop any rust spots.
meanings.sent3: The rustproof metal gate laughed at the rain, knowing it couldn't harm it.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like a rustproof shield, impervious to the corrosive effects of betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The rustproof coating on the bridge made it gleam like a diamond in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To treat or coat with a substance to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent1: He decided to rustproof his tools to ensure they would last longer.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic rustproofed the underside of the car to protect it from salt on the roads.
meanings.sent3: She playfully rustproofed her bicycle, joking that it was now 'indestructible.'
meanings.sent4: The gardener rustproofed the metal fence, giving it a new lease on life.
meanings.sent5: The sailors carefully rustproofed the ship before setting sail on the salty sea.
